geostan 0.0.1
  • Reference

Spatial data diagnostics

Source: R/convenience-functions.R
sp_diag.Rd

Visual diagnostics for areal data and model residuals

sp_diag(y, shape, name = "y", w = shape2mat(shape, "W"), plot = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

y

Either a numeric vector or a geostan_fit model object (as returned from a call to one of the geostan::stan_* functions).
shape

An object of class sf or another spatial object coercible to sf with sf::st_as_sf such as SpatialPolygonsDataFrame.
name

The name to use on the plot labels; default to "y" or, if y is a geostan_fit object, to "Residuals".
w

An optional spatial connectivity matrix; if not provided, then a row-standardized adjacency matrix will be created using shape2mat.
plot

If FALSE, return a list of gg plots.
...

Additional arguments passed to residuals.geostan_fit. For binomail and Poisson models, this includes the option to view the outcome variable as a rate (the default) rather than a count; for stan_car models with auto-Gaussian likelihood (`fit$family$family = "auto_gaussian"), the residuals will be detrended by default, but this can be changed using `detrend = FALSE`.

Value

A grid of spatial diagnostic plots: a map, a scatter Moran plot, and a histogram of y. If a fitted geostan model is provided, model residuals are plotted and mapped (i.e. y = resid(fit)$mean). If `plot = TRUE`, the `ggplots` are drawn using grid.arrange; otherwise, they are returned in a list.

See also

me_diag, mc, moran_plot, aple

Examples

library(sf)
data(georgia)
sp_diag(georgia$college, georgia)

#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x'

fit <- stan_glm(log(rate.male) ~ 1, data = georgia, chains = 1, iter = 500)

#> 
#> *Setting prior parameters for intercept
#> Gaussian
#>  location     scale 
#> -4.169701  3.000000 
#> 
#> *Setting prior parameters for sigma
#> Student's t
#>       df location    scale 
#>       10        0        1 
#> 
#> SAMPLING FOR MODEL 'glm' NOW (CHAIN 1).
#> Chain 1: 
#> Chain 1: Gradient evaluation took 1.4e-05 seconds
#> Chain 1: 1000 transitions using 10 leapfrog steps per transition would take 0.14 seconds.
#> Chain 1: Adjust your expectations accordingly!
#> Chain 1: 
#> Chain 1: 
#> Chain 1: Iteration:   1 / 500 [  0%]  (Warmup)
#> Chain 1: Iteration: 251 / 500 [ 50%]  (Sampling)
#> Chain 1: Iteration: 500 / 500 [100%]  (Sampling)
#> Chain 1: 
#> Chain 1:  Elapsed Time: 0.011093 seconds (Warm-up)
#> Chain 1:                0.008967 seconds (Sampling)
#> Chain 1:                0.02006 seconds (Total)
#> Chain 1: 
#> Warning: Tail Effective Samples Size (ESS) is too low, indicating posterior variances and tail quantiles may be unreliable.
#> Running the chains for more iterations may help. See
#> http://mc-stan.org/misc/warnings.html#tail-ess
sp_diag(fit, georgia)

#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x'

cp <- prep_car_data(shape2mat(georgia))

#> Range of permissible rho values:  -1.661134 1 
fit2 <- stan_car(log(rate.male) ~ 1, data = georgia, car_parts = cp, iter = 500, chains = 1)

#> 
#> *Setting prior parameters for intercept
#> Gaussian
#>  location     scale 
#> -4.169701  3.000000 
#> 
#> *Setting prior parameters for car_scale
#> Student's t
#>       df location    scale 
#>       10        0        1 
#> 
#> *Setting prior for car_rho (spatial autocorrelation parameter)
#> Uniform (1/lambda_min, 1/lambda_max)
#>   minimum   maximum 
#> -1.661134  1.000000 
#> 
#> SAMPLING FOR MODEL 'car' NOW (CHAIN 1).
#> Chain 1: 
#> Chain 1: Gradient evaluation took 5.5e-05 seconds
#> Chain 1: 1000 transitions using 10 leapfrog steps per transition would take 0.55 seconds.
#> Chain 1: Adjust your expectations accordingly!
#> Chain 1: 
#> Chain 1: 
#> Chain 1: Iteration:   1 / 500 [  0%]  (Warmup)
#> Chain 1: Iteration: 251 / 500 [ 50%]  (Sampling)
#> Chain 1: Iteration: 500 / 500 [100%]  (Sampling)
#> Chain 1: 
#> Chain 1:  Elapsed Time: 0.420318 seconds (Warm-up)
#> Chain 1:                0.394198 seconds (Sampling)
#> Chain 1:                0.814516 seconds (Total)
#> Chain 1: 
#> Warning: Bulk Effective Samples Size (ESS) is too low, indicating posterior means and medians may be unreliable.
#> Running the chains for more iterations may help. See
#> http://mc-stan.org/misc/warnings.html#bulk-ess
#> Warning: Tail Effective Samples Size (ESS) is too low, indicating posterior variances and tail quantiles may be unreliable.
#> Running the chains for more iterations may help. See
#> http://mc-stan.org/misc/warnings.html#tail-ess
sp_diag(fit2, georgia)

#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x'
sp_diag(fit2, georgia, detrend = FALSE)

#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x'
